quoteFirst: , it will be 5° 18′ south of the moon. It will rise on the 1st at 6:29 a. m.; on the 16th, at
quoteLast: ; and on the 30th, at 8:26 a. m., and set on the corresponding days at 4:47, 4:51, and 5:14 p. m., being a morning star for the first four days and evening star for the remainder of the month, and perhaps visible to the naked eye on the last day.

quoteLast: --One minute to go. I have not seen a single German shell burst yet. They may be firing on our trenches; they are not on our batteries.
title: Letters from France
author: Bean, C. E. W. (Charles Edwin Woodrow), 1879-1968
